item.title: The parts of Myanmar the military junta doesn't want you to see
item.description: Myanmar's military is holding its first elections since overthrowing a democratically elected government in 2021. But as it aims to portray a sense of normality, signs of the junta's menacing presence are everywhere.

item.title: Mid North Coast brumby program rehomes 160 wild horses across Australia
item.description: About a third of the brumby population on the NSW Mid North Coast has been rehomed through a program designed to give wild horses a second chance as pets.

item.title: Naomi Osaka loses United Cup match to Maria Sakkari ahead of Australian Open
item.description: Just over two weeks from the season-opening major, former world number one Naomi Osaka reveals she is not at full health after contracting a viral illness over the Christmas period.

item.title: Tesla loses title of bestselling EV company to BYD as sales drop
item.description: Tesla sales have declined for the second consecutive year, with Chinese rival BYD surpassing it as the world's largest electric vehicle maker.

item.title: Police hunt for offenders after shooting in Melbourne's inner north
item.description: Police are searching for offenders, who are believed to have driven past in a silver SUV and fired shots at a young man, before fleeing the scene.

item.title: Barbecue explosion prompts safety warning after Qld beautician's burns
item.description: Rachel Dear has a serious warning for anyone using a gas barbecue after she suffered significant face and body burns while cooking on Christmas Eve.

item.title: Coffee pods generate thousands of tonnes of waste in Australia. Here's what is being done about it
item.description: Between 10 and 20 per cent of the 3 million coffee pods Australians consume daily are actually recycled. Here's what's being done to change that.

item.title: Photographs of Men in Love exhibition reveals public glimpses of forbidden love
item.description: What started as a chance discovery of an old photo at a Dallas antique store has spawned a collection of more than 4,000 images of male couples, more than 100 of which are now on display in Canberra.

item.description: Dozens of shorebird species flock to northern WA for summer during their global migration.

item.description: Middle Percy Island is a rare gem where boaties can come ashore and wander through thousands of mementos left by travellers from across the globe.

item.title: Former Darwin councillor's ex-partner speaks out after guilty domestic violence verdict
item.description: Former Darwin councillor Paul Arnold was found guilty of domestic violence after a years-long court battle, with his ex-partner refusing to be scared into silence. She said the case was "stressful and deeply humiliating", but facing her abuser had been empowering.

item.title: NSW Police riot squad to carry long-arm firearms at Sydney Ashes series following Bondi attack
item.description: Officers will carry long-arm firearms as part of a bolstered police presence at the Ashes series in Sydney in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Premium beef producers expect to be the main casualty of China's new 55 per cent tariff
item.description: Australian cattle farmers producing wagyu and Angus beef are likely to be among the hardest hit by China's 55 per cent tariff on exports exceeding a 205,000-tonne quota.

item.title: Local government inspector Tony Brown granted new powers to probe WA councils and 'improve accountability'

item.title: Venezuela updates: Venezuelan opposition demands release of all political prisoners
item.description: Nicolás Maduro and his wife face court in New York after being captured by US forces as House Democrats leader Hakeem Jeffries accuses US President Donald Trump of lying to the American people about the reason for the attack — as it happened.

item.title: Australia's Emerson Jones wins through at Brisbane International as Kimberly Birrell and Olivia Gadecki advance
item.description: At 17, Emerson Jones shows why she is one of the brightest prospects in Australian tennis, as she wins through to the second round in Brisbane.

item.title: Prime minister announces $38 million for flood-affected communities across north-west Queensland
item.description: A number of communities remain on flood watch, while a traveller is in hospital after walking through knee-deep mud after he became bogged in outback Queensland on Saturday.

item.title: The country town program ensuring age gaps are no barrier to friendship in Bungendore
item.description: In a country town near Canberra, a program run by an aged care provider and the local high school is seeing positive results in breaking down barriers between younger and older community members.

item.title: Concern over SA's algal bloom pushing visitors to other SA tourist towns
item.description: An algal bloom that has been ravaging parts of SA's coast for months is pushing visitors to head to other parts of the state.

item.title: Mother of 13yo who fell pregnant in state care says system 'ruining lives'
item.description: Child safety experts say the case of a 13-year-old girl who became pregnant while in state care highlights the dangers of the residential system.

item.title: Banyule locals question whether North East Link caused sinkhole at Heidelberg football oval
item.description: A sinkhole has opened up in Banyule Flats Reserve, close to where a North East Link tunnel boring machine is operating.

item.title: ASX runs out of steam despite Wall Street rally, BlueScope shares surge — as it happened
item.description: Australian shares retreat into into the red, while steel producer BlueScope gains 20 per cent on a takeover tilt. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Coco Gauff loses singles but US makes United Cup quarterfinals with win over Spain
item.description: The US secures a United Cup quarterfinal berth after Coco Gauff makes up for a shock singles loss by helping win the deciding mixed doubles rubber.

item.title: Delcy Rodríguez officially sworn in as Venezuela’s interim president.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Convicted scammer Patricia McIntyre allegedly targeting victims in new pet and house-sitting con
item.description: Dozens of people from multiple states have come forward after allegedly falling victim to a new pet and house-sitting scam orchestrated by career con artist Patricia McIntyre.

item.title: Donald Trump's other goal in the Venezuela strike was to get China out of Latin America
item.description: Venezuela has spent years getting cosier with China. Now Donald Trump is sending a clear warning to Beijing — get out of his backyard.

item.title: Before Venezuela there was Panama and the first US capture of a Latin American leader
item.description: Thirty-six years to the day before this week's capture of Nicolás Maduro the United States's invasion of Panama led to the capture of its de facto ruler General Manuel Noriega.

item.title: As Victoria's grassland dries with warmer weather, the CFA warns of increased fire risk
item.description: Grassland in Victoria has dried significantly since September, including in the north-west of the state and in outer Melbourne, putting firefighters on edge.

item.title: Yarloop locals mark decade since bushfire destroyed 160 homes and killed two people
item.description: Ten years after a bushfire took just seven minutes to tear through Yarloop, residents say community spirit and support from neighbouring towns helped get them through the tragedy.

item.title: Council criticised for removing 'illegally planted' trees from sensitive sand dunes
item.description: A Queensland council is being criticised for uprooting unauthorised saplings from sand dunes amid a long-running vegetation battle.

item.title: Novak Djokovic withdraws from Australian Open lead-up event at Adelaide International
item.description: With the Australian Open on the horizon, Novak Djokovic does not feel he is well enough prepared to contest next week's Adelaide International.

item.title: Ashes 2026: Steve Smith fires Australia to dominant position on day three of fifth Test at SCG
item.description: Australia leads England by 134 first-innings runs after a dominant day three at the SCG, punctuated by centuries to Travis Head and Steve Smith.

item.title: Site selection delayed for desalination plant Lower Great Southern needs 'to survive'
item.description: Plans for a desalination plant in Western Australia's Great Southern are delayed as the clock ticks to secure a critical water source.

item.title: Top Trump adviser refuses to rule out military action to take over Greenland
item.description: Stephen Miller, Mr Trump's chief of staff for policy, said the Trump administration believed Greenland should become an American territory in order for the US to "protect and defend NATO".

item.title: Destructive Los Angeles-like fires possible for Australia's capital cities, report warns
item.description: Australia's capital cities are increasingly at risk of being affected by a major fire like the one that ravaged Los Angeles last year, according to a new climate report.

item.title: Scenic Rim Council red tape on camping pushes farmer to consider selling up
item.description: A Scenic Rim farmer says the costs of getting a council permit to host campers are so high he may have to sell his property.

item.title: Dragons sign Keaon Koloamatangi from Rabbitohs on massive five-year NRL deal
item.description: Dragons supporters will have to wait until 2027 to see Keaon Koloamatangi wearing the Red V, but the club describes his signing as the "biggest" in their recent history.

item.title: Woman who lost home in Koolewong bushfire reunited with cat seriously injured in blaze
item.description: Sassy the cat was almost killed when a bushfire razed a Koolewong home on NSW's Central Coast. Now, the lucky pet has been reunited with her family.

item.title: US cuts number of vaccines recommended for children including flu, hepatitis A and B
item.description: The US government takes the unprecedented step of cutting the number of vaccines it recommends for every child, a move long sought by Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr. But medical groups say it undermines protections against diseases.

item.title: Future of historic Paringa Bridge uncertain as it nears 100-year anniversary
item.description: South Australia's only vertical-lift bridge has been unable to rise for more than a week due to a mechanical malfunction, affecting holiday-makers and locals alike.

item.title: Three NFL teams sack coaches on league's traditional Black Monday
item.description: For struggling NFL teams, the end of the regular season triggers an annual exercise in bloodletting known around the league as Black Monday.

item.title: Former Queensland senator Ron 'Bozzie' Boswell dies aged 85
item.description: Known as "Bozzie" to his mates and colleagues, Mr Boswell's political career spanned three decades.

item.title: Man charged in connection to alleged Hanukkah car arson in Melbourne's south-east
item.description: A man is charged after an alleged arson attack on a vehicle with a Hanukkah decoration on Christmas morning in Melbourne's south-east.

item.title: Police appeal for information on 2012 disappearance of Kalgoorlie-Boulder man Charlie Park
item.description: Fourteen years after Charlie Park disappeared in regional WA, detectives have reopened the case and are calling for information from the community.

item.title: BlueScope Steel weighing up $13 billion takeover by Kerry Stokes's SGH and US partner
item.description: Kerry Stokes-controlled firm SGH has launched a $13.2 billion takeover bid for BlueScope Steel, in partnership with a US steelmaker.

item.title: Aboriginal mother of five identified after death in NT police watch house
item.description: A Sydney-based law firm says it is representing the family of a 44-year-old Aboriginal woman who died in custody at the Tennant Creek police watch house.

item.title: Denmark and Greenland PMs condemn Trump's territorial ambitions
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: EU, Britain join condemnation of sexual deepfake images created with Grok AI
item.description: A digital undressing spree on Elon Musk's social media site has prompted investigations from countries including France, India and Malaysia.

item.title: South Australian MP Nick McBride will contest state election after assault charge
item.description: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride says he will run for re-election, as he remains on home detention after spending 10 days behind bars for an alleged assault against his wife.

item.title: Who is Cilia Flores? The woman by Nicolás Maduro's side until Donald Trump threw them in detention
item.description: Her husband Nicolás Maduro calls her Venezuela's "first combatant" because she is not just a spouse, but a fellow fighter in the Chavism movement and a political player in her own right.

item.title: NSW Liberal leader Kellie Sloane announces new shadow cabinet
item.description: The opposition leader says she does not consider the gender breakdown of her shadow ministry, which has 16 men and 10 women.

item.title: Venezuela left as 'potential powder keg' after Maduro capture, experts say
item.description: The US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has left the country with an uncertain future, sparked concern among regional neighbours and could embolden other countries in territorial disputes, some experts say.

item.title: Madison Keys, Aryna Sabalenka kick off Australian summer of tennis with wins at Brisbane International
item.description: Defending Australian Open champion Madison Keys and last year's runner up Aryna Sabalenka both got their Australian summer off to winning starts with straight-sets victories at the Brisbane International.

item.title: Actor Mickey Rourke turns to crowdfunding to avoid eviction from LA rental
item.description: The actor, who faced accusations of homophobia and inappropriate behaviour on set last year, could now lose his home.

item.title: Anthony Albanese doesn't rule out calling royal commission into Bondi terrorist attack
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese does not rule out calling a royal commission into the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, but says his immediate priority is the review of intelligence and security agencies.

item.title: Here's how sinkholes can form underground long before anyone realises
item.description: The sudden collapse of a sinkhole in Melbourne's north-east left residents shocked on Tuesday. Here's an explanation of how and why they form.

item.title: Public library visitor numbers return to pre-COVID levels as cost-of-living crisis bites
item.description: Public libraries in Australia are experimenting with inventive ways to attract new members — but a lack of funding means they must do more with less.

item.title: After Venezuela, Donald Trump's other threats ring alarms around the world
item.description: Donald Trump is talking about where US forces might venture next. But one of his cabinet secretaries could provide the clearest clues.

item.title: Disappearance of outback woman declared major crime by SA Police
item.description: Investigators hold "grave fears" for Trisha Graf's wellbeing, after she was last seen in the early hours of December 12.

item.title: NSW Police commissioner extends restrictions on Sydney protests for another fortnight
item.description: The NSW police commissioner will extend temporary protest restrictions across Sydney for another two weeks.

item.title: WA Police raid Bunbury tobacconist after suspected firebomb of different vape store
item.description: Police seize vapes and cigarettes from the South West WA store days after two different shops were destroyed.

item.title: Ben Austin died in a cricketing tragedy. His parents Jace and Tracey blame no-one as they speak out for the first time
item.description: Ben Austin died in late October after a being struck by a cricket ball. For the first time his parents speak exclusively about the incident and their belief no-one is to blame for the tragic accident.

item.title: Some NSW farmers say 10 guns are not enough ahead of planned restrictions
item.description: New gun laws in NSW will limit farmers to 10 guns but the industry says this is not enough, and the change could see "a whole lot more firearms and ammunition" moving between farms in vehicles.

item.title: Sam Groth to relinquish deputy Liberal leadership at February party room meeting
item.description: The outgoing MP will vacate the deputy leadership role in February, clearing the way for a refreshed leadership team to carry the opposition to this year's election.

item.title: Bondi terror attack royal commission pressure trumps Albanese's beliefs
item.description: Whether or not Anthony Albanese believes a federal royal commission is necessary, or even the best use of resources, is now politically irrelevant.

item.title: Teen faces court over Baldivis convenience store arson linked to illegal tobacco trade
item.description: A boy who allegedly set fire to a Baldivis convenience store may be facing threats from organised crime figures, Perth Children's Court hears.

item.title: Steve Smith treats Sydney to a Smudge Day, in all its weird and wonderful glory
item.description: Steve Smith was at his bizarre best on day three in Sydney, grinding England into the dust with his scintillating strokeplay and trademark oddness.

item.title: Steve Smith plays his greatest hits as Will Jacks drops sitter and Ben Stokes burns reviews— quick hits from day three of the SCG Test
item.description: Steve Smith plays all his greatest hits en-route to a century as England suffers in the field on all fronts. Here are your quick hits from day three.

item.title: Tuesday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios out of Brisbane International as reality of multiple surgeries hits home
item.description: Nick Kyrgios limped out of the Brisbane International at the first hurdle as the 30-year-old's ailing body lets him down once again.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Jenna the second system to lash Cocos Keeling Islands in less than two weeks
item.description: Residents of the islands clean up following heavy rain and winds brought by Tropical Cyclone Jenna, less than two weeks another system battered the region on Christmas day.

item.title: Human remains found in search for snorkeller missing off WA's Ledge Point
item.description: Police confirm human remains have been found washed ashore north of Perth, believed to be those of a 32-year-old man missing since New Year's Day.

item.title: The tragic death of young cricketer, Ben Austin
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: What are Nicolás Maduro and Cilia Flores alleged to have done?
item.description: The US has justified the seizure of deposed Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and wife Cilia Flores by arguing they had breached US domestic law. So what exactly have they been accused of doing?

item.title: Stuart Clark denies confrontation with Cricket Australia chief Todd Greenberg over controversial comments
item.description: Stuart Clark opens up on his conversation with Cricket Australia chief Todd Greenberg after his stinging criticism.

item.title: National freight routes affected after train partially derails in South Australia
item.description: Several train wagons have derailed in South Australia, affecting key freight services connecting the country.

item.title: Australia's spot booked at United Cup quarter finals after De Minaur's high-pressure double act
item.description: Twin wins from world No.6 Alex de Minaur have dragged Australia off the canvas and into the United Cup quarter-finals with a do-or-die victory over Czechia.

item.title: US set to back Ukraine defence coalition if peace deal made with Russia
item.description: A draft statement outlines what Ukraine's allies could commit to if Russia attacks its neighbour again in the future.

item.title: Fire safety inspections lapsed for years at Swiss bar where 40 died in New Year's blaze
item.description: Swiss authorities admitted that fire safety inspections hadn't been carried out since 2019 at Crans-Montana bar where 40 people died on New Year's Eve.

item.title: European leaders rally behind Greenland amid threats of a Trump take-over
item.description: The US president and his officials are continuing to push for an American take over of the Danish territory, saying the island is needed for national security.
